ilo: Apply understanding of content knowledge relating to biological, chemical, physical, earth and space sciences to plan, structure, sequence, assess and evaluate teaching strategies to promote science learning for all young children in early childhood and primary settings.

Employ evidence-based teaching and assessment strategies and knowledge of the Victorian Curriculum: Science and the Victorian Early Years Learning & Development Framework to effective science learning and lesson plans for young children.

Plan, structure and sequence effective and challenging science learning and lesson plans using knowledge of young children's learning, understanding of biological, chemical, physical, earth and space science content and pedagogical approaches within inquiry frameworks.

Apply understanding of how young children learn in the context of science education, enabling differentiation of science teaching for all students to embrace diversity and ensure equity and inclusivity.
Integrate a range of resources, including ICT, into planning and managing learning sequences to expand and promote science learning opportunities for all students.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Digital Learning Product: Creation of a Digital Learning Product to support Primary Students' science learning
Critical Response: Written response to an early childhood learning opportunity containing science potential and development of learning experience plan
Online quizzes: A series of online quizzes covering biological, chemical, physical, space and earth science content knowledge

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).

date_times.contact_hours: 24 hours (22 hours on-campus and 2 hours asynchronous online)
